reviews.text: You can see the photo to understand my review! Apart from the exorbitant prices, the products were below average!!! They do not correspond to a 5 star hotel! It is rare to eat such a bad club sandwich in all of Italy! And the girls at the entrance are completely helpful…. And the room prices are unrealistic without corresponding to the level of the room and the services! You pay a fortune for the gardens!!!!!! Choose another hotel!!!

We visit Rome every year and have stayed at other phenomenal Rocco Forte properties but this one really stood out!

The secret courtyard garden was just magical, we only wish it hadn’t rained the night we were planning to dine in the gorgeous courtyard!

We’ve visited Hotel de Russie for a brunch,
and wow such an amazing and unique place even just to be there !

The bar and the staff is amazing but for the menu I was expecting a lot more than that…

Environment, the garden, the building all is amazing even just to stare at them !

So being in Hotel de Russie is quite an experience but the food is not that great what can I say :)

Some unique brunch or dinner options or lets say a Michelin Star rest. would be easily one of the best in the world with all that history of the palace :)

Regards and cheers

Absolutely stunning! The location couldn't be any better, in walking distance to many attractions, right im the downtown area. The hotel itself is beautiful, especially the hidden backyard in which you can escape the noise of the city - it feels like a little oasis, so green and lush and cozy. And then the staff: incredibly attentive and friendly. Every detail is cared for and their hospitality is unmatched. Thank you for a most wonderful stay.

We visit Rome every summer and have stayed at Hotel de la Ville nearby 2 years ago which was lovely and we didnt expect Hotel de Russia to beat, but it was truly such a wonderful experience! The garden courtyard is just magical - our only regret is we brought rain to Rome, so couldn't sit in the beautiful courtyard for our dinner.
